epic.title: Mobile-First Loop Monitor
epic.description:
Redesign ralph-monitoring as a mobile-first loop monitoring experience. Three core screens: (1) Loop Dashboard — quick-glance list of active loops with status/progress, (2) Loop Detail — live 'what's happening now' view with current task, recent activity feed, and all-steps list, (3) Live Log — full-screen streaming log viewer.

This replaces the previous mobile epic activity approach (PR #99) which added data cards but missed the UX redesign. The new approach is phone-first: optimized for checking in on the go.

Existing code to reuse:
- Server utils from codex/2026-02-03-mobile-epic-activity-view branch (epic-activity.server.ts, epic-metadata.server.ts) — cherry-pick or reimplement as needed
- Existing components: EpicProgress, AgentTimeline, LoopControlPanel, LogViewer, ProgressBar, MetricCard
- Existing routes: epics._index.tsx, epics.$epicId.tsx (keep as-is or evolve)
- Design tokens: apps/ralph-monitoring/docs/DESIGN_LANGUAGE.md
- UI primitives: apps/ralph-monitoring/app/components/ui/*

Key principles:
- Mobile-first layout: stack vertically, large tap targets, minimal chrome
- Information hierarchy: status → current task → recent activity → all steps
- SSE streaming for live log view (existing LogViewer pattern)
- Auto-refresh on loop detail (existing 5s revalidation pattern)
- Calm, technical UI per design language: neutral surfaces, compact density

tasks.title: Loop Dashboard — Mobile Epic List
tasks.description:
Redesign the epics index (`/epics` or new `/` route) as a mobile-first loop dashboard.

Branch: codex/2026-02-09-mobile-loop-monitor

Goal: A phone-optimized list of active loops. Each loop card shows:
- Epic name + status badge (running = green pulse, paused = amber, idle = gray)
- Progress bar (tasks completed / total)
- Current task name + agent type (if running)
- Time since last activity (relative: '2m ago', '1h ago')
- Tap entire card → loop detail

Impacted Files:
- apps/ralph-monitoring/app/routes/epics._index.tsx (redesign)
- apps/ralph-monitoring/app/db/beads.server.ts (may need to expose current-task + last-activity-time per epic)

References:
- apps/ralph-monitoring/app/routes/epics._index.tsx (current implementation)
- apps/ralph-monitoring/app/components/ProgressBar.tsx
- apps/ralph-monitoring/docs/DESIGN_LANGUAGE.md

Acceptance Criteria:
- Cards are full-width, stacked, large tap targets (min 48px touch area)
- Running loops sort to top
- Status is visually distinct at a glance (color + icon)
- Responsive: works on 375px width, scales up gracefully
- Auto-revalidates every 10s when tab is visible

Testing:
- Component test for card rendering with various states
- Test sort order (running > paused > idle > closed)
- Test relative time formatting

tasks.title: Loop Detail — Live Status + Activity Feed
tasks.description:
Build the loop detail view (`/epics/:epicId` redesign) as a mobile-first 'what's happening now' screen.

Branch: codex/2026-02-09-mobile-loop-monitor

Layout (top to bottom):
1. **Header**: Back arrow + epic name + status badge + pause/resume button (compact, single row)
2. **Now Card**: If a task is in_progress — show task name, agent type, elapsed time, and a prominent 'Watch Live' button (links to live log view). If idle/paused — show last completed task + outcome.
3. **Recent Activity**: Last ~10 execution log entries as a compact feed. Each row: timestamp (relative) + task name (truncated) + outcome icon (✅❌⏭️). Tap row → task detail page.
4. **All Steps**: Collapsible/expandable section listing every task in the loop in order. Each shows: status chip (pending/running/done/failed/skipped) + task title. Tap → existing task detail route.

Impacted Files:
- apps/ralph-monitoring/app/routes/epics.$epicId.tsx (redesign)
- apps/ralph-monitoring/app/components/NowCard.tsx (new)
- apps/ralph-monitoring/app/components/ActivityFeed.tsx (new)
- apps/ralph-monitoring/app/components/StepsList.tsx (new)

References:
- apps/ralph-monitoring/app/routes/epics.$epicId.tsx (current)
- apps/ralph-monitoring/app/components/LoopControlPanel.tsx
- apps/ralph-monitoring/app/components/AgentTimeline.tsx (data patterns)
- apps/ralph-monitoring/app/db/beads.server.ts

Acceptance Criteria:
- Single scrollable view, no horizontal scroll on mobile
- Now Card is visually prominent (slightly elevated surface)
- Activity feed entries are compact (one line per entry on mobile)
- All Steps is collapsed by default, expands on tap
- 5s auto-revalidation (existing pattern)
- Back navigation returns to dashboard

Testing:
- Component tests for NowCard (running vs idle states)
- Component tests for ActivityFeed (empty, few, many entries)
- Component tests for StepsList (collapsed/expanded, various statuses)
- Route integration test with createRoutesStub

tasks.title: Live Log — Streaming Log Viewer
tasks.description:
Add a full-screen streaming log view accessible from the loop detail's 'Watch Live' button.

Branch: codex/2026-02-09-mobile-loop-monitor

Route: `/epics/:epicId/live` (or similar)

Behavior:
- Full-screen, dark background (terminal aesthetic), monospace font
- Connects to existing SSE log stream endpoint (`/api/logs/:taskId/stream`)
- Auto-scrolls to bottom as new lines arrive
- Tap to pause auto-scroll, resume button appears
- Back button (top-left) returns to loop detail
- Shows current task name + status in a thin header bar
- If the active task changes (new task starts), auto-switch to the new task's stream

Impacted Files:
- apps/ralph-monitoring/app/routes/epics.$epicId.live.tsx (new)
- May reuse/adapt LogViewer component patterns

References:
- apps/ralph-monitoring/app/components/LogViewer.tsx (existing log viewer)
- apps/ralph-monitoring/app/routes/api.logs.$taskId.stream.ts (SSE endpoint)

Acceptance Criteria:
- Log lines stream in real-time via SSE
- Auto-scroll works, pause/resume is intuitive
- Readable on mobile (font size, line wrapping)
- Minimal chrome — almost all screen is log content
- Graceful handling of stream end / task completion

Testing:
- Component test for scroll behavior
- Test stream connection and reconnection
- Test task-switch behavior
